works.complaint:
The use on these pages of the text "Raspberry Pi"  
infringes trademark #2503550, the Word Mark "Raspberry Pi", registered in 

the UK in the name of The Raspberry Pi Foundation.

On the site's home page is a claim to being "the official online supplier 

of the Raspberry Pi", and the site also purports to sell peripherals and  

accessories with the Raspberry Pi brand. No official Raspberry Pi-branded 

peripherals or accessories exist at the present time.

Using the trademark to sell identical goods and similar goods to those
sold  
by the trademark owner is infringing if it creates a likelihood of  
confusion on the part of the public. I submit that site is liable to
create  
such a confusion, even if only briefly, on the part of people who come  
across it in Internet search results.

Using the trademark is infringing if it takes unfair advantage of the  
reputation of the registered mark, where the registered mark has a  
significant reputation, as Raspberry Pi does. I submit that this site
takes  
unfair advantage of the trademark by falsely claiming to be an official  
supplier and to sell non-existent branded goods.

See
